name: Avalon Hotel

reviews.title: fantastic location
reviews.text: We stayed there for 4 nights and really enjoyed it...we stayed in deluxe queen size which was really large with 2 double beds....just a few steps to 5th Avenue and Empire State Building...the hotel staff at the reception were always helpful and friendly....So i can just recommend to everyone who wants to stay in the centre of the town....

I travel to NYC several times per year but had occasion to visit recently for a vacation w/ my family. As I usually stay (for business) in the high end 5 star hotels, my wife made the accommodations and thus I had no idea what to expect. Fortunately, I was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Excellent value

reviews.text: We had 2 queen beds plus a pull out sofa which was perfect for our family of 5. Very spacious for Manhattan! The room itself was nice and clean and everything worked properly. The hotel is interesting because very few of the guests spoke English (I heard mainly French) so it has a true European "feel".
reviews.title: Fantastic weekend break in NYC

reviews.text: The staff was very attentive and nice; the doorman was especiialy helpful and cheery on our arrival.
reviews.title: needs a spruce up but not bad

reviews.text: There is also a neat little restaurant next door; they had a tremendous duo playing flute and piano, which adds to the Euro feel.
reviews.title: Excellent location and superior staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Down for long weekend, 2 night stay. Drove right there from VT, pulled in front, unloaded the car with help of quick to react doorman. They park your car after you fill out some car retrieval forms. Check in was easy, threw stuff in room. And off to visit with our oldest son who lived ~12 blocks away. Room was plenty big enough, had a sitting area. Bathroom was bigger than any in my house. Bed was great... only issue, one of the 2 nights was noisy outside in the street. We were close to restaurants, 1 block from the Empire St bldg (Go up @ 8 to 8:30am and it was very uncrowded). 4 or 5 blocks from MSG, where we caught a Bruins/Rangers game. Wilson, the doorman was great and helpful in many ways. Met expectations, great loction, great price.
reviews.title: Great location / Met expectations / Great price

reviews.text: This hotel should not advertise that they have wifi. In a week-long stay I was NEVER able to make a connection strong enough to send an email out. (At Starbucks around the corner I could send things out fine, so it's not my device.) The wired connection is just as bad, or worse, as the plug on the internet cable is broken en you need to hold it and shimmy it constantly to make it function.
reviews.title: No wifi, and they had dirty sheets, yuck!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would've rated it with 2 stars if it wasn't for the last night and finding out the cleanliness was worse than I thought. They don't give you new sheets unless you specifically ask for it by putting a card on the bed. I did so and when I went to bed that night I noticed that they had just flipped the sheets instead of cleaned them/given me new ones. (I recognized a couple of stains.) Also, after the 3rd day I didn't receive washcloths anymore.
reviews.title: Very good choice

reviews.text: I choose a hotel based on 2 things, they need to have free wifi and be clean. The Avalon had neither. Will never go there again and will advise co-workers/clients to avoid this hotel as well!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: This is a great option for people wanting a central location, with easy access to all parts of the city. The bedrooms are large compared to most New York Hotels and although the decor is a little dated, they are clean, well maintained and have everything you need (free WiFi, IPod Dock etc). Other services are minimal (just a breakfast room), but as New York has great options 24 hours a day, this is not a problem. The rates are also very reasonable.
reviews.title: Great value & central location

reviews.text: The Avalon is centrally located, just down the street from Penn Station. Its walking distance to great shopping and almost all of the subway lines are nearby. The rooms are huge - I booked a Junior Suite and that was one of their average rooms. While there is no restaurant, the hotel serves an extensive continental breakfast buffet with fresh squeezed juices, yogurt parfaits, cereals, pastries and donuts, and good strong coffee. The bathroom was very spacious, and the large flatscreen tv's were nice. There is free WiFi, and there is a business center in the lobby for internet access and printing a boarding pass. The staff were all friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Best location with the biggest rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely hotel. Clean, quiet, comfortable and has character i.e. it;s been around a while. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Highly recommendend.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is about a 20 minute walk from Times Square but away from the noise. Had the best sleeps ever at this hotel. Our room was really large, not just by New York's standard, but by any standard. It had a mini bar and separate fridge to cool your own water etc. Bathroom was very large. Rooms could do with a lick of paint but they were fine. Breakfast buffet was nice and free coffee available in the lobby for a limited time in the morning. Two free computers for internet access, very handy for printing off online ticket purchases. Small area with guide books for browsing was a nice touch. Staff were not overly friendly but were very helpful when approached. We paid about €140 per double room. At that rate it was excellent value. Most useful subway was about a 10 minute walk away. Only thing this hotel lacked was a bar and swimming pool. If going to the airport walk out on to 5th ave and hail your own cab. We didn't take the porter's option as it was a little more expensive.
reviews.title: Great value and location. Huge rooms for New York.

reviews.text: This was reasonably priced and touted itself as a four star hotel, but there wasn't much special about it. For me the best thing was the proximity to Korean food (its in Korea town) which I ate everyday. Otherwise the neighbourhood isnt as charismatic as Greenwich or Soho.
reviews.title: Good but not great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent service, location is fantastic, great rooms... Unfortunately, it was a little chilli for the rooftop pool...
reviews.title: Superb hotel...

reviews.text: I just spent 4 nights at the Avalon Hotel in Gothenburg, Sweden and it was, without a doubt, the BEST stay I've had at any hotel in Scandinavia - and, in fact, maybe anywhere. And I've been to some pretty amazing places around the globe.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Scandinavia

reviews.text: Artful, amazing design
reviews.title: Great hotel, fashionable and centrally located

reviews.text: The NICEST, MOST ACCOMMODATING PEOPLE WORK THERE!
reviews.title: Business stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The amenities in the rooms - huge deep bathtubs, gorgeous views, hot water pots with
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, excellent rooms and outstanding breakfast.

reviews.text: The location is perfect for shopping, nightlife and great food.
reviews.title: Central location with a nice design

reviews.text: The staff is nice but nothing extra, we asked the Concierge for guestlist and restaurant reservation but the couldn't help. I had hoped for more.
reviews.title: Great location excellent service!

reviews.text: The rooms are nice and with great facilities.
reviews.title: Different

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast area is a bit small and feels crowded. The waitresses are stressed and in a rush by the end of breakfast hours.
reviews.title: Perfect - We will return

reviews.text: This is a veryyyy long overdue review actually from Dec 2010.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel, staff could not have been nicer, even let us check in 3 hours before official check in time. Storage of bags no problems with no obligatory costs charged. Free internet access in rooms and tea and coffee in reception, refreshing change from Hilton hotel chain we stayed in previously. Easy 10 minute walk from Penn Station. Overall lovely stay and will return.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel in New York
Cold showers, rude staff, slow wifi, silly room design
reviews.text: I would not recommend this hotel. The biggest problem with this hotel is the luke warm "hot" water. Hotel staff would not admit there was a problem. I was shivering while showering. I asked other customers at the hotel if they also had cold showers and they did.
Located in Midtown, this hotel is perfectly situated to some of New York's most important landmarks. Just a few minutes walk from the Empire State Building, Macy's and Times Square.
reviews.title: Great location, great value for money, great place to stay in New York!!
Awesome Room!
reviews.text: The hotel is well appointed and has very decently furnished rooms for prices that are half that of comparable places in Manhatten.
The reception and house-keeping staff are exceptionally friendly and go out of their way to make sure you have a great stay!
reviews.title: Awesome localization!

reviews.text: Great hotel right in the centre of Gothenburg. Close to all the shopping and other amenities. Breakfast is what you would expect. Not overly big rooms but super comfortable beds, well appointed bathroom. All very stylish and funky. Wouldn't suit families ie more than one child, great for couples and business travel
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Avalon has so much going for it, not least of all the amazing staff. Nothing is ever too much and from the breakfast crew in the morning to the bar staff in the evening the service is seemless and welcoming. The front desk personnel are forever smiling and always friendly and helpful. We arrived at 10am and were fine to check straight in to the room, plus my GHA Platinum card was recognised and a 6pm check-out was handled with a smile and a minimum of fuss (and no extra charge).
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel in a Fantastic City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the breakfast (which was hot and plentiful) and also the oysters and champagne offer in the bar, along with a few cocktails.
reviews.title: Ok but not as good as expected

reviews.text: The hotel is very modern 'Scandinavian-designer' which is a nice touch if you are sick of soulless American chain hotels elsewhere in Europe. The excellent design and size of the rooms (we overlooked the square in front of the hotel) made for an amazing stay. I agree with the complaints about the shower/wet room design in that it was prone to a little leakage, however a conveniently placed towel took care of the extra water and ensured it wasn't a great bother. The bath was very deep and the Bulgari bathroom products very luxurious. The Dove Body Wash attached to the shower wall was a bit budget-like however and not very consistent with the rest of the hotel.
reviews.title: A warm & a unique experience. Perfect place to get you acquainted to the charming city of Gothenburg.

reviews.text: The location is fantastic and is central to everything in Gothenburg, which is an amazing city in itself - although if you do need to take taxis be warned that they are extremely expensive - 220kr to Liseberg which is <2kms!!!
reviews.title: Do not book online because you can not cancel the reservation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located perfectly when staying in Gothenburd just to have a nice-walk around- shop a little-have good food and wine-stay. The location is surprisingly calm as resturants and shops are just a step out the front enterance. Our room was huge (superior), clean and fresh. (several pillows for those who like that). The staff are young, trendy and helpful. I actually became sceptic; are they really this nice? I thought, but yes, I think they are.
reviews.title: Perfect for pleasure

reviews.text: One of the best things was the breakfast! We sat there way too long eating.. And that was possible when Sunday's breakfast is served until noon - which is great!
reviews.title: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at ....

reviews.text: Great location. Exciting decor. No two rooms are similar. Very trendy. Great service. And I mean every word of it. I travel 90% of my time across Europe and no other hotel I stayed at in this price range (London, Paris, Berlin, Stuttgart, Bristol, Amsterdam, Eindhove, Toulouse, Stvangar, Stockholm, Hamburg, Dusseldorf ...........) has even come close to this in terms of value for money and service. Highly recommended for any one visiting Gothenburg
reviews.title: This is only my opinion, but it is the correct one!

reviews.text: I have been travelling a lot in business all over the world and I have to say, this is one of the best business hotels I have every been on. Fom the service, food, room. All is top notch!
reviews.title: Good location for business or pleasure

reviews.text: We recently stayed in the Avalon. Husband had business meetings nearby & I joined the trip for some sightseeing. We enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Great location, cool hotel

reviews.text: Everything about the Avalon lived up to or exceeded our expectations, which is why it gets a top rating. We were a party of 5 and stayed for 4 nights from 31st May.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel at midday, our luggage was taken care of and were told that we could book in straight away if we didn't mind rooms on different floors, but the rooms reserved for us were close together on the 7th floor and would be available a little later. We chose to wait, went to a local deli for a coffee just along the road (which the doorman recommended). We were not disappointed with the quality of the rooms, and the beds were extremely comfortable, as mentioned by others.
reviews.title: Great hotel, perfect location and wonderful staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All through our stay the staff were helpful and friendly, giving advice on how to get to places, booking cabs etc. all as you would expect. There is free internet and printing, which was extremely useful.
reviews.title: new york new york

reviews.text: As for location, just about perfect. Between 5th and Madison Avenue, you can get uptown or downtown in a short time on the subway for a flat single journey fare of $2.50! otherwise the cabs are relatively cheap we generally paid about $8.00 to get anywhere on Manhatten.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: New York was a fantastic experience, and we did all the usual tourist sites. A few tips, we pre booked the New York Pass and did the Empire State Building at about 09.00, no queues, we were at the top in about 10 minutes. By the time we came down about an hour later, there were hundreds queueing. The Skyride experience was a little disappointing. The Rockefeller Centre was done in the evening with only minor queues. Other attractions were 'The Beast', exhilarating and fun. Liberty Island is worth the trip, although access to the Statue is closed at the moment.
reviews.title: Perfect Location!

reviews.text: I had read mixed reviews on the Vincci Avalon prior to arrival in New York, but I am happy to say that the hotel was lovely. Check in was super smooth, with very friendly and charismatic staff. I found Melody to be particularly friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: Beds most comfortable hotel beds ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was a Junior Suite on the 9th floor. The bathroom was nicely presented with twin sinks, separate tub and shower and was always very clean. The view from the room was not great, but to be honest we were never there to see the view. Mini bar prices were extremely high, but again a minor detail. We had 2 large flat screen Sony tv's in our room which was a lovely touch. Then there was the bed!!! What a bed it was too. Massive, with the most luxurious cotton sheets and lovely warm duvet. It was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and great staff

reviews.text: The hotel itself is located on 32nd street. It is just round the corner from the Empire State Building and a few blocks from Macy's. Closest subway is 33rd street which offers easy connections to midtown, uptown and downtown Manhattan.
reviews.title: Hard to find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a wonderful stay in NYC, with some great staff and a hotel in a great location, that is close enough to touch all of the sites, but far enough away not to wake you up in the morning!
reviews.title: Fantastic and have Recommended to Friends!!!

reviews.text: We happened upon the hotel on a web search and booked because of the great price. We stayed this past week for the Westminster Dog Show and can not say enough great things about the staff and hotel. Everyone was exceptionally polite and helpful. The price got us to book this hotel but the staff will keep us coming back. We usually pick a different hotel everytime we travel to New York but will only stay at the Vincci Avalon from now on. It is convenient and the excellent service makes the stay truly enjoyable.
reviews.title: Good location - quiet

reviews.text: Great hotel - with free wi-fi, spacious jr suite, and great location to NY attractions. Close to Grand Central & airport shuttle.
reviews.title: Hotel Buzz!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've stayed at the Avalon from 11. - 18. May 2012 / Executive Suite ( Room 404 / 4th floor). It's not a modern stylish Chelsea or Tribeca place. But it's Laura Asley style is charming and for exploring the city it's perfectly located. Overall a very good New York experience. Room was spacious and very clean. Got fresh linen and towels everyday. Extra services, like room service, are not available. Could recommend this hotel if you don't want to pay more than aprox. 350 USD plus tax per night.
reviews.title: Good place central location

reviews.text: We stayed here for a family holiday to New York, and apart from a few hiccups, found it to be great! There was a 'mix-up' (their words) when we arrived, and only one of the rooms was ready for our first night, which was slightly annoying. I managed to sort alternative accommodation for one night, so it wasn't the end of the world. Although they initially only offered to upgrade one room (not very helpful, as we had already booked suites) and not charge us for the first night of the unavailable room (I almost burst out laughing when I heard this...how very nice to not charge me for a room I can't stay in!), after a bit of negotiating, they agreed to give the four of us free breakfast for the whole week. Once this was out of the way, we could get on with enjoying everything the hotel and New York had to offer. The staff were friendly, the location is amazing, the tea and coffee facilities were a nice touch, the rooms were clean and comfy....would highly recommend!
reviews.title: Apart from a few 'mix-ups', a very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In NY we prefer to avoid the busy, unattractive area around Times Square and find a hotel which is still very close to all attractions, with subway and buses nearby. That´s why we choose the Avalon. We had an Executive Suite which was really big- big bathroom with Jacuzzi and shower , big bedroom with very comfortable bed and separate ,smaller living room . Two subway stations nearby plus several buslines on 5th Ave make exploring NY easy. Plenty of restaurants nearby: For breakfast we found a very nice Diner on 33rd/ Lexington 222 within five minutes walking distance .
reviews.title: Excellent location - big ,comfortable rooms

reviews.text: The Avalon is not cheap ,but we have paid more in other hotels ( certainly depending on the time when travelling) , where rooms have been far smaller . Certainly a hotel we will put onto our " Come back" list.
reviews.title: A good place to stay smack in the middle of Manhattan

reviews.text: Tremendously beat up rooms, paint chipping everywhere, looking over a fire escape (perhaps a typical NYC hotel view), no hotel restaurant or bar, A/C does not get turned kn until legally required in Manahttan, so in 80 dgree weather last week heat only was available, indifferent staff, overall a real wast of money in a poor location.
reviews.title: Weak hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed this hotel! Fantastic location! We will defintely stay with Avalon again.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: Tip: Ask for a room away from the street.
reviews.title: Very happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Avalon hotel in 2 rooms, one was a king suite and my adult sons stay in a room with 2 double beds. Both rooms had plenty of space, the beds were comfortable.
reviews.title: fantastic hotel

reviews.text: It was walking distance to the Empire State building and we walked to times square which is a little over a mile. (A cab is about $6-8 depending on traffic.) Don't use the guys pedaling bikes, they are a total rip off.
reviews.title: Great!

description: The Avalon Hotel New York is centrally located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, convenient to all neighborhoods. Only two blocks from the Empire State Building, the Avalon Hotel New York is also only a few blocks from seven subway lines. Penn Station is down the street from the Avalon and easily accessible to the East Side airports, LaGuardia and JFK. Guest rooms are very spacious, with the majority over 400 sq.ft., many with two beds and a sofa bed. With only 100 rooms, the Avalon Hotel New York is a classic boutique hotel with personal service and exceptional value. Conference space is available for intimate gatherings or business meetings.
